Pre-steak sauce, this alphanumeric term meant "first class" for ships at Lloyd's of London
A payment to an insurance company; as an adjective, it means "more expensive"
This 5-letter prefix can be followed by -dor, -did, -diforous, or, in a sweetener, -da
Your social standing could be described as this, the uppermost part of the cabinet or dresser
This "P" word can mean an example of excellence--like one "of virtue"

clues.text: Describing her divorce from this director, Linda Hamilton said, "'Titanic' was the mistress he left me for"
Reba McEntire was first offered this unsinkable role; Kathy Bates eventually played her
A 3-D version of "Titanic" was released in this year for the 100th anniversary of the real Titanic disaster
The only 3 of the 14 Oscar nominations "Titanic" didn't convert were for makeup, Kate Winslet & this actress
The single highest grossing day for "Titanic" was this holiday, a Saturday 58 days after the film's December opening
Your heart will go on, & your lungs & kidneys too if you're an organ donor, indicated in California by a pink sticker on this
You won't become a heart donor until this other organ of yours has zero function
Donated hearts have extended the lives of Democrats like Governor Robert Casey & Republicans like this vice president
If your heart goes to someone else, it must fit neatly into this 2-word structure formed by 24 bones
In 1967 the heart of young Denise Darvall went on as this surgeon performed the first human heart transplant

rounds.category: THERE IS ROOM ON THAT BOARD!

clues.text: If you want to join the board of directors, we need to put your name in for a vote by these people
There should be 5 people on the board & we only have 2! One more is needed to hit this Latin-named majority
Last name of cereal heiress Marjorie, one of the first women for whom a major corp. made room on its board
We need another body on this alliterative committee to figure out who much to pay the CEO
If you're the vice president or chief justice, there's a spot for you on this D.C. institution's Board of Regents
If someone gets upset in France, this condiment "got up his nose"--Dijon, I expect
The Cheyenne ask, "are you still riding the goat?" to see if you are still on the outs with this person
In the U.S. someone frantic has his hair in this state; in China the same thing happens to the eyebrows
When someone dies in Denmark, he is said to have taken off these wooden shoes
In Russia if you're kidding me, you're hanging noodles from my ears; we use this idiom related to a lower paired body part
Over 300,000 rock fans attend the original Woodstock festival
Haile Selassie is overthrown & Patty Hearst is kidnapped
As Secretary of Labor, Frances Perkins becomes the first woman cabinet member
For bathing beauties, bikinis are introduced
The Salk polio vaccine is released in the United States
Aka custodians, they may use the supplies of the Cintas Corp., which sponsors an award for the one of the year
A gemologist always works to scale, measuring precious stones in these, each one equal to 2/10 gram
A specialized job in a police force, CSI stands for this, just like on TV
clues.response: crime scene investigator ("crime scene investigation" accepted)

clues.text: In 1968 a U.S. craft with this name, also George Washington's pre-military occupation, landed on the moon
2-word term for one who studies the plant & animal life of the oceans
Oh, Lord, this unit of temperature is abbreviated K
Also used to measure off the distance between duelists, as a unit of measure it equals 30 inches
Plane angles are measured in degrees or this unit whose symbol is rad
Pharmacists know that a grain equals about 65 of these, a more typical unit for pill doses
Ahoy! it's equal to 6,076.11549 feet

Force out, such as air from the lungs

This Louise Fitzhugh heroine isn't a secret agent, she just documents the actions of her schoolmates
Mark Twain said his favorite book of all those he had written was his fictional biography of this French lass
A young woman from Chile moves to Calif. during the gold rush in "Daughter of Fortune" by this author
Marlee & Liz are 12-year-old girls whose 1950s friendship helps fight segregation in "The Lions of" this state capital
A man named Auric is the title villain in this 1964 James Bond film
August 2017 marked 40 years for Leslie Charleson playing a doctor on this TV show
Mr. O'Neal of NBA fame went on "Lip Sync Battle" & chose this B-52s song
Director Chris Columbus' production company is named for this year
A meme asked what concert cost 45 cents? the one with this rapper aka Curtis Jackson & this "Breathe" Canadian band
